resource.source:
<objectXMLWrap>
               <did xmlns="urn:isbn:1-931666-22-9">
                  <unittitle>Connecticut State Labor Council, AFL-CIO Records</unittitle>
                  <unitid>1989.0080</unitid>
                  <repository>
                     <corpname>Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Libraries</corpname>
                  </repository>
                  <langmaterial>
                     <language/>
                  </langmaterial>
                  <physdesc>
                     <extent>202.5 Linear feet</extent>
                  </physdesc>
                  <unitdate>undated, 1909-1991.</unitdate>
                  <abstract>In 1957, the Connecticut Federation of Labor and the Connecticut State Industrial Union Council (CSIUC) merged to form the Connecticut State Labor Council, AFL-CIO, generally referred to today as the Connecticut State AFL-CIO. The stated purpose of the new organization was to provide a more effective means of promoting and coordinating the principles and objectives of the AFL-CIO in Connecticut.</abstract>
                  <origination>
                     <corpname>AFL-CIO Connecticut State Labor Council.</corpname>
                  </origination>
               </did>
            </objectXMLWrap>
resource.title: Connecticut State Labor Council, AFL-CIO Records undated, 1909-1991.
resource.abstract: In 1957, the Connecticut Federation of Labor and the Connecticut State Industrial Union Council (CSIUC) merged to form the Connecticut State Labor Council, AFL-CIO, generally referred to today as the Connecticut State AFL-CIO. The stated purpose of the new organization was to provide a more effective means of promoting and coordinating the principles and objectives of the AFL-CIO in Connecticut.
resource.displayEntry: Connecticut State Labor Council, AFL-CIO Records, undated, 1909-1991.
